reviews.text: combat in Babylon’s Fall can be fun initially but grows repetitive and stale quickly.
the use of 4 weapons at once is fun in practice and allows for some cool damage setups but little else.
combat is extremely limited with most combos happening just by holding a button.
the combat feels heavy; while players can knock enemies into the air, can’t juggle enemies like past Platinum action games.
the designs of most of them are boring and repetitive.
the graphics are the ugliest game... the brush stroke effect is a mess.
the cash shop is very prominently displayed and explained.
the game is a GaaS but priced at $59.99
the story is pretty all over the place
the co-op is boring, no cool team up combos
the early game is monotonous, can’t craft weapons until later
the technical brush strokes cause nausea in the demo but toned down
the game's art style is a bland, dull mess
the monetization wants you to spend on cosmetics
the story is worse than Elden Ring's approach
the combat lacks the fluidity of past Platinum titles like Astral Chain
the level design has empty hallways leading to spawns
the game feels basic, nothing about it screams its asking price
the early game is so bad that the average person will be turned off before reaching the good parts
the technical brush strokes are nauseating in the demo but toned down
the game's art style is a moving oil painting mess
the monetization elements are aggressive with cosmetics
the story is not done as well as Elden Ring
the co-op only allows you to get through levels faster
the early game is so bad that players will be turned off before the good parts
the game is hands down the ugliest next-gen title
the combat's combos are just holding buttons
